content: a darn good bag let s get crocheting about this pattern is a variation of another pattern i have called the bee kind bag i did not have any testers for this pattern so i appreciate your feedback on this fun vibrant bag the name of the bag is inspired by the yarn the yarn has a great story and i am honored to support darn good yarn company with creating this pattern using their handmade recycled silk fiber designer my name is theresa randall and i rediscovered knitting and crocheting during covid and haven t looked back i love designing almost everything i make so hope to spread my designs to others as i continue to create release date oct 5 2025 material needed materials needed hook 5 5 mm us i-9 stitch marker yarn needle optional 1 large button yarn needed darn good yarn twist worsted weight silk used approx 110 yards 159 grams gauge not critical for this project finished size approximately 9 tall laying flat with a 18 strap ** **because of the open design and i-cord strap it will expand 2-4 inches depending on how much weight is in the bag stitches & chain chain abbreviations single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch hbhdc herringbone half_double_crochet yo skip 1 st insert hook into next st yo and pull through the st and the first loop on hook yo and pull through remaining 2 loops notes the bag is worked in the round from the bottom up a magic_ring is used to start the base strap is a 3-stitch i-cord worked directly from the edge pattern instructions bag bottom using 5 5 mm hook make a magic_ring magic_ring tutorial by bobbiny round 1 8 single_crochet in ring pull ring tight place marker 8 sts round 2 2 single_crochet in each st around 16 sts round 3 2 single_crochet in next st 1 single_crochet in next st repeat → 24 sts round 4 2 single_crochet in next st 1 single_crochet in next 2 sts repeat → 32 sts round 5 2 single_crochet in next st 1 single_crochet in next 3 sts repeat → 40 sts round 6 2 single_crochet in next st 1 single_crochet in next 4 sts repeat → 48 sts round 7 2 single_crochet in next st 1 single_crochet in next 5 sts repeat → 56 sts round 8 double_crochet in each st around no increase → 56 sts if you want the base wider- continue on round 8 with 2 single_crochet in next st 1 single_crochet in next 6 sts repeat bag body round 1 *double_crochet single_crochet in same st chain 2 skip 2 st* repeat around round 2 skip first double_crochet and single_crochet in space between each double_crochet/single_crochet cluster double_crochet single_crochet chain 2 repeat around repeat round 2 until desired height sample shown 10 rounds ~5- 5 5 bag top round 1 hbhdc into every other st around 44 sts rnds 2 5 hbhdc in each st around round 6 hbhdc for 19 sts
